stimulusHtml:
PERCENT OF ADULT WOMEN WHO HAVE AN ACCOUNT WITH A BANKING INSTITUTION

Country 2011 2017
Pakistan 3% 7%
Bangladesh 26% 36%

Source: World Bank

By tradition it is uncommon for women to hold personal bank accounts in Pakistan, and until the 1990s this was much the same in Bangladesh. Which of the following best explains the significant change in the percent of women with bank accounts in Bangladesh?
choicesHtml: The increased access to microlending institutions for women, such as the Grameen Bank
The increased number of women leaders in national politics, such as Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina Wazed
The increased number of coeducational universities, such as the University of Dhaka
The decrease in access to landownership for many women, such as those working in agriculture
The decrease in the total fertility rate due to health initiatives, such as government-sponsored family-planning programs
